original: KLINGA, Karl Ivar, överingenjör, Gävle, f Harg, Sthlms l, 17/7 90 av stins Joh K o Hilda Broberg, gm Margareta Steinbeck. Mog.ex Upps 08, ex KTH (kem teknol) 11. Kemist o ing v Skogens Kol AB 11—16, assist åt tekn dir v Helsingborgs Gummifabriks AB 16 —17, anst v Korsnäs Sågv AB, cellulosafabrikerna, sed. 17: chef f biprod.avd o lab, seder-mera chef f kem o elektr avd v cellulosafabr i Karskär, 1:e driftsing där 35, övering sed. 42. Styr.led i Skogsägarnas Olje AB sed. 41. Led av styr f Tekn Frn i Gävle 33—34, led av Sv Pappers- o Cellulosaing.frns Gvlbgskté f standardisering av cellulosaprovn 30—34. Av trycket: Myrsyra i barrvedsträsyra (Bih JKA, 14), Analysmetoder f råa terpentin- o träoljor (ibid, 17), Om tekniska metoder f framställn av absolut alkohol (Tekn Tidskr 34). Led Sv Tekn.frn o Sv Pappers- o Cellulosaing.frn.
translated: KLINGA, Karl Ivar, chief engineer, Gävle, b. Harg, Stockholm county, 17/7 1890, son of stationmaster Joh K and Hilda Broberg, m. Margareta Steinbeck. Formerly a student at Uppsala University, graduated in 1908, and at the Royal Institute of Technology (chemical technology) in 1911. Chemist and engineer at Skogens Kol AB from 1911 to 1916, assistant to the technical director at Helsingborgs Gummifabriks AB from 1916 to 1917, employed by Korsnäs Sawmill AB, cellulose factories, since 1917: head of by-products department and laboratory, later head of chemical and electrical department at the cellulose factory in Karskär, first operating engineer there in 1935, chief engineer since 1942. Board member of Skogsägarnas Olje AB since 1941. Board member of the Technical Association in Gävle from 1933 to 1934, board member of the Swedish Paper and Cellulose Engineering Association for the standardization of cellulose testing samples from 1930 to 1934. Publications include: "Formic Acid in Coniferous Wood Acid" (Bih JKA, 1914), "Analytical Methods for Crude Turpentine and Wood Oils" (ibid, 1917), "Technical Methods for the Production of Absolute Alcohol" (Tekn Tidskr 1934). Member of the Swedish Engineering Association and the Swedish Paper and Cellulose Engineering Association.
